lg.l: An Inundation Says the fable
O'er flow'd a farmer's Barn & Stable
Whole Stacks of hay & reeks of Corn
Were down the Sudden Current born
While things of Hetrogenius kind
Together float wtḥ tide & wind
The generous wheat forgets his pride
And Sailed wtḥ Litter side by side
Uniteing all to shew their Amity
As in a Generall Calamity
A Palepeice of ?neattnew dropt horses dung
Mingleing wtḥ aples in the throng
Say'd to a pippins plump & Prime
See brothṛ how wee apples Swim
Thus Lamb Renowned for cutting corns
An offer'd Fee from Ratlif Horns
Not for the world wee Doctrs. Brother
Must take no fees from one another
Thus to a Dean some Curate Sloven
Subscribes Dṛ Sṛ yṛ brother loveing
Thus all the footmen shoe boys porters
Abṭ Sṭ Iames'ṣ cry wee Courtiers
Thus Horace in the house will prate
Sṛ wee the Ministers of the State
Thus at the Barr the booby B──·──th
tho' ½ a Crown out pays his Sweatsworth
Who khole in law nor text nor Margentdefective manuscript Serjeantdefectivedefective
Our Brother Protestants & Christians
As much as Hebrews & Philistians
But in no other Sense than Nature
Hath made a Ratt our Fellow Creature
Lice from the body suck their food
But is a louse then flesh & blood
Tho' born of human filth and Sweat it
May be said man did begett it
Butt Maggotts in the Nose & Chin
As Well may Claim yụ for their Kin
Yet Criticks may object why nott
Since Lice are brethren to a S────────
Which made our Swarm of Sects Determine
Employmts. for their brother Vermine
Butt be they Irish English Scottish
What Protestantblotts can be soe sottish
While o'er the Church these clouds are Gathering
To call a Swarm of Lice his brethern
As Moses by divine advice
In Egypt turn'd the dust to lice
And as our Sects by all descriptions
Have hearts more hardned than Egyptians
As from the throdden dust they Spring
And turn'd to Lice Infect the King
For pity sake it wou'd be just
a rod shou'd turn yṃ into dust,
Let folks in high or holy stations
Be proud of owning such relationshole Courtiers hugg yṃ in their bosomhole they holeemhole
While I wtḥ humble Iob & rather
Say to Corruption thou art my father
